definition: Restructuring existing code to improve its design, readability, or performance without changing its external behavior

positive_examples: Refactoring extracts the duplicated logic into a reusable helper function.
The code refactoring renames variables to more descriptive names throughout.
AI-assisted refactoring converts the class hierarchy to use composition.
Refactoring splits the 500-line function into smaller, focused methods.
training_hints.disambiguation: Structural improvement without behavior change, not general editing
